projects.name: ASCII Cube
description:
ASCII cube was our first failure. The intention was to create a 3d render of an ascii cube
that would rotate and zoom in an out, following commands from given arrow keys. Needless to say this was
overly ambitious for only 2 hours

projects.name: ASCII Paint
description:
ASCII Paint was the first 2 hour project, and one of our favorites for how silly it is.
all it does is take inputs with WASD and place a character in the terminal with space. It also comes with multiple
brushes that can change the way you paint. It was a very fun project to work on and holds a special place in out heart

projects.name: Chatroom
description:
This chat room will work on a good day, because we are poor we can't afford firebase and
 
can only read so much data from our server, this one allows you to send messages back and forth with anyone else
that wants to access the webpage. You can clear the chat by typing clear in the box though

projects.name: Discord Bot
description:
This is a discord group created for our friends, during the Covid-19 pandemic we got really
into watching B-movies, and wanted to make a bot for our discord that would help us pick them
this bot allows you to add movies to a list and pick them, you can also remove movies, pick a random one
or clear the whole list. It also has utility features like rolling a dice or generating a random number, or picture
our favorites though are the shame feature which will shame a random member, and the big command which makes any text
into big emojis

projects.name: Emoji Checkers
description:
I mean its basic checkers, but with a few exceptions. You can't multi-jump, and you are not forced to make
a move if you can we could have implemented them, but we ran out of time give it a try if you want 
there isn't a bot so bring a friend too

projects.name: Fish Tank
description:
Incremental games our a guilty pleasure of ours so of course we had to make one
it's uhh not very good... 2 hours isn't really enough time to balance a game, and being our first project
in javascript it looks pretty ugly too, but it works so thats about as much as we could ask for.
Give it a try, and let us know if you can beat it...(you can btw it takes like 3 minutes).

projects.name: Weather Website
description: This one is probably one of the most functional websites we have built. It tells you the weather
given that you allow location settings. It works by grabbing your coordinates from a geo location api, and then
it uses those to grab the local weather forecast from a government weather registry, it isn't the prettiest
but it was our first website that didn't look half bad...

projects.name: Swarm Simulator
description:
Swarm simulator takes a bunch of pixels, and makes them swarm around your mouse.
It look's pretty cool, we highly recommend you check it out if you get the chance
 
Probably the best looking project we have done.

projects.name: Cellular Automata
description:
This is a recreation of the famous game of life created by John Horton Conway
In this version there are starting colonies, and 2 separate color factions that are
 
at war with each other. It's completely random, but we always root for red.

projects.name: Text Game
description:
This one counts as our second failure. A fully fledged text game in 2 hours is a little more than we can handle.
To test it out though type options to see a list of all the commands you have.
 
We could not implement items, treasures rooms, the void, or a story sadly. But, you can still fight the enemies
and work your way up to the boss

projects.name: Sandbox Simulation
description:
We really liked our cellular automata so we decided to take it a step further and make a derivative. 
This time we added sand, water, and air into the mix to bring about more complexity 
 
In this version you can interact with gravity and pour water over everything in a semi-realistic way
Give it a try!

projects.name: Graphing Software
description:
Inspired by desmos we wanted to see how hard it actually was to create graphing software.
The big problem with doing this through the canvas element was translating the canvas coordinates to cartisian coordinates
As well scaling the coordinates while zooming in. After figuring out the math behind that though it was simple to code the rest.
We skipped using a parser by using javas built in evaluator so it takes in javascript for its function arguments.
